text: {{Infobox settlement | name = Beni Suef Governorate | settlement_type = Governorate | image_flag = Governadorat de Bani Suwayf.png | flag_size = 120px | image_blank_emblem = Coat of arms of Benisuef Governorate.gif | blank_emblem_size = 75px | image_map = Beni Suef in Egypt.svg | map_caption = Beni Suef Governorate on the map of Egypt | coordinates = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = | seat = Beni Suef (capital) | leader_party = | leader_title = Governor | leader_name = | government_footnotes = | area_footnotes = | area_total_km2 = 1,322 | area_land_km2 = | area_water_km2 = | population_footnotes = | population_total = 3214000 | population_as_of = January 2018 | population_density_km2 = auto | timezone1 = EET | utc_offset1 = +2 | timezone1_DST = | utc_offset1_DST = | website = | iso_code = | calling_code = | footnotes = }} Beni Suef is one of the governorates of Egypt. The capital city is also named Beni Suef. The nearby Meidum pyramid is the only prominent tourist attraction in the area. ==References== Category:Governorates of Egypt
title: Beni Suef Governorate
